title: Unforgivable Sin

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: ...So, we have a bit of a predicament. I know it's none of your affair, but we would greatly benefit from laguz assistance in our hunt for last night's escapee.

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: No problem. I could use a little exercise before breakfast.

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: Thank you, King Tibarn! Please, follow me.

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Why are the others up so early? What's going on?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Is it the Disciples of Order? Are we under attack?

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: No, Your Majesty... It's not the Disciples of Order. If you'll excuse me, I must go!

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: Wait, Geoffrey! ...Who does he think he is?

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: Bastian! What in the world is going on? I insist on a straight answer!

intro.speaker: Geoffrey
intro.line: Your Majesty! Sister! Why are you here?

intro.speaker: Lucia
intro.line: That's not important! Explain why there are Feral Ones here!

intro.speaker: Bastian
intro.line: See that odious man among them? He's controlling them. He is using fell magic to summon the poor laguz souls who were turned into Feral Ones! He is the man who escaped our custody last night. Volke found him just now.

intro.speaker: Bastian
intro.line: His name is Izuka. He designed the process that created the Feral Ones!

intro.speaker: Tibarn
intro.line: What?! He's the butcher who twisted the lives of my kinsmen? He won't die quickly. I'll make sure his screams are heard in Phoenicis, Gallia...even Goldoa.

intro.speaker: Izuka
intro.line: ...Dare not speak to me that way again... My work is humanity's greatest triumph... Depraved? Ha! ...Show them the meaning of genius! Come, my children, defend me! Come, my Feral Ones!

intro.speaker: Elincia
intro.line: We can't let a creature that twisted roam free. We must fight!

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: Oh! Queen Elincia!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Amy! You’re safe! Oh, I’m so glad! It’s so good to see you!

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: I came here with General Geoffrey.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: With Geoffrey?

conversation.speaker: Geoffrey
conversation.line: I was outside on the day when the bright light engulfed everything. At first, I thought that time had stopped. Then I realized that time was normal, but everyone around me had been turned to stone. I rode around the city to investigate, and I found this little girl crying in Calill’s bar.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Did you find anyone else? What about Largo?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: No... How tragic. How am I going to tell Calill?

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: Mommy is here!? I want to see my mommy!

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Yes. She is here, Amy. Lucia?

conversation.speaker: Lucia
conversation.line: Yes, Your Majesty. Amy, do you want to see your mommy? Here, take my hand. We’ll go together.

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: Yay! I can’t wait to see her!

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: How unusual. I can’t believe a small child like that has been saved from petrification. Isn’t she the first?

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: King Tibarn, Prince Reyson.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: I’d assumed that only the people with a certain amount of power were safe from petrification, but I guessed wrong.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: I’m wondering if there are even rules at all.

conversation.speaker: Elincia
conversation.line: Hmm.

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: Mommy!

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: Amy! You’re safe! Thank goodness. I’m so glad!

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: M-Mommy! Daddy couldn’t move! H-he wouldn’t say anything! He... Sniff... Wahhhhhhh!

conversation.speaker: Calill
conversation.line: There, there. It’ll be all right. Mommy will take care of Daddy. Mommy and Queen Elincia are going to save all the people who can’t move. Everything will be all right. Daddy will be back soon. I promise.

conversation.speaker: Amy
conversation.line: All right... Sniff... Sniff...

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Sheesh, all I’m saying is that you should take it, Ulki!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: No... You are older than me. One must respect one’s elders. It’s yours, Janaff.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: That’s not fair! You only say things like that when it’s convenient for you. We’re only five years apart!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Five years is five years. You deserve the perks due someone of your age. You take it.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Did you just call me an old codger!?

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Come on, I don’t care who keeps it. Just make a decision already.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Shut up, Tibarn! This is between me and Ulki!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Should you really be addressing your king with words like those?

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Who cares? It’s not like anyone else can hear.

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Selfish little magpie.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Hey! Lookit me! I’m Ulki, the solitary peacock!

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: All right, Janaff, that’s enough.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: What?! How am I the one getting scolded!?

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: You too, Ulki. You know how to press his buttons. Don’t egg him on like that.

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: ...Fine.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: What are you fighting over?

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: They’re arguing over who would take my gift. Neither of them seem willing to take it.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: Really? How uncharacteristically selfless of you to put up a fight, Ulki.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: What do you mean, White Prince? Ulki is just being an ungrateful wretch for not appreciating my thoughtfulness! He’ll never understand!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Since the item is so nice, I thought that you should have it. I’m not the stubborn one here.

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: Well, since neither of you want it, I’ll take it.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: What!?

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: ...Prince Reyson?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: It will come in handy during a battle, right? Then I’ll wear it and fight next to Tibarn. Sure, it’s good to be thoughtful and giving, but if neither of you appreciates it, there’s no point.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Reyson’s right! All right, this is for you. Reyson can be my one and only aide from now on. I shoulda thought of this sooner.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: W-wait! No, I’ll take it!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: No, I shall take it.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Ulki?

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Once we have it, Janaff and I will discuss who should wear the item.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Do you agree to this, Janaff?

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: Um... Yes, I do. I have no problem with that.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: Reyson?

conversation.speaker: Reyson
conversation.line: That’s fine with me. As long as you agree to keep me nearby, I’m all right with whatever you decide.

conversation.speaker: Tibarn
conversation.line: It’s a done deal, then. Now, don’t you two feel a little stupid after getting lectured like that? And by Reyson, as well!

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: ...Sorry, Ulki.

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: I... I apologize, too.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: I’ve been with you and Tibarn since our feathers hadn’t even grown in yet. I guess we know each other a little too well. Well, the White Prince certainly reminded me of who I am. I’m an aide to the king of Phoenicis!

conversation.speaker: Ulki
conversation.line: Me, too. Here, Janaff. This is for you.

conversation.speaker: Janaff
conversation.line: ...Hey, wait a minute! You think you pulled a fast one on me, don’t you?! Get back here, Ulki!

recruit-talk.speaker: Elincia
recruit-talk.line: You seem to have some time on your hands... Would you mind helping us?

recruit-talk.speaker: Volke
recruit-talk.line: ...That's what the job will cost you in gold.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elincia
recruit-talk.line: Fine. I shall pay you that amount after the battle.

recruit-talk.speaker: Elincia
recruit-talk.line: Thank you. And, if I may ask...

recruit-talk.speaker: Elincia
recruit-talk.line: Why do you need so much money?

recruit-talk.speaker: Volke
recruit-talk.line: That's what it will cost you for me to answer that question. Are you prepared to pay it?

recruit-talk.speaker: Volke
recruit-talk.line: Then let's get to work. What shall I do first?

recruit-talk.speaker: Bastian
recruit-talk.line: Ah, my partner in crime. How shall I convince you to move those leaden feet of yours into action? How much "convincing" will it cost?

recruit-talk.speaker: Bastian
recruit-talk.line: I thought I was the jester. Considering your usual schedule of services, three thousand is negligible!

recruit-talk.speaker: Volke
recruit-talk.line: I don't like that guy. Call it a personal discount. Do you want it or not?

recruit-talk.speaker: Bastian
recruit-talk.line: Of course I shall take your discount! Do as you wish when you see him. Now get to work.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Disgusting filth. I can't kill him enough times for what he's done!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: At least he is finally gone. No one else will suffer by his hands.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I suppose that is all there is, then.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: Laguz brothers and sisters, I hope your souls can find peace now.
Hey! Count Bastian!

end.speaker: Jorge
end.line: That man in the black cape you left with us is in bad shape! We can't even hold him down anymore!

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Oh no... Your Majesty, we must return immediately. I will explain everything.

end.speaker: Daniel
end.line: Oh, thank goodness you're here! I couldn't hold him down anymore. Please, follow me!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Aaaaargh! Ahhh! Grrr... Graaaagh!

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Shhh! Calm down, sir. It's all right. You are a strong man. You will pull through! Please, you must calm yourself! Duke Renning!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: It cannot be!  Uncle! Uncle Renning! You are alive! Oh, you are alive!

end.speaker: Renning
end.line: Ugh... Ahhhhhh! Grrr...rr...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: What's wrong, Uncle? Please speak to me! It's me, Elincia!

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: It's no use, Your Majesty. Your noble uncle's mind has been broken...by the drug that creates Feral Ones.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: No! How did this happen? Uncle! Uncle! You must hold on! Uncle Renning...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Forgive me. Please give me a moment to collect myself.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: What happened back there? Who is that man?

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: That is Duke Renning, the younger brother of Crimea's last king, and Queen Elincia's uncle. He was next in line to become the king of Crimea, but-- He was believed killed in the last attack by Daein, three years ago.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: I see. And what's wrong with him now?

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: Bastian. No more secrets. It's time for you to tell us everything you know.

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Duke Renning was apparently killed three years ago... but as you can see, he is still alive.

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Duke Renning was one of the strongest warriors in Crimea, and while Daein tried to kill him, he survived. When the Mad King heard of his skill, he had Renning kidnapped and gave him the drug that creates Feral Ones. This drug made Duke Renning even stronger, but shattered his mind. He became Bertram, one of Ashnard's infamous Four Riders. After Her Majesty and company defeated him, I had him taken back to my castle. I hoped to find a cure, but I didn't want to raise false hope, Your Majesty, so I kept the secret. However, his mind continued to deteriorate, and there were no signs of improvement. As a last resort, I hired Volke to investigate a way to cure him.

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Volke quickly discovered that Duke Renning's transformation was engineered by a man called Izuka. This man had made himself an aide to the new king of Daein and was not difficult to locate. Feeling that Renning was running out of time, we kidnapped Izuka to learn more of the condition.

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: Returning to Fayre Castle, we interrogated Izuka at length and discovered more about his experiments. Perhaps unsurprisingly, beorc are affected differently by the drug than laguz. Izuka then offered to create an antidote in exchange for his freedom.

end.speaker: Geoffrey
end.line: Did you agree to it?!

end.speaker: Bastian
end.line: We refused without a second thought. Such a monster cannot be allowed to roam free. Besides, we know a more certain way to cure Lord Renning.

end.speaker: Lucia
end.line: The galdr of rebirth!

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Prince Reyson, I beg of you. Please save my uncle!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I can't guarantee anything, Elincia. But I will try.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh, thank you, Prince Reyson! Thank you!

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Please give me a moment to myself. I must prepare.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Are you sure about this? I thought the galdr of rebirth was too powerful and complex for a single heron to perform.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: Usually, that's true. Right now, however, Ashera's awakening has infused the world with order; I've never felt stronger. What's more, Lord Renning's condition seems less severe than a true Feral One. I think I can do this.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: Well, you're the expert. Just don't go taking unnecessary risks.

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: I won't, Tibarn. You needn't worry so much. I've grown a lot.

end.speaker: Renning
end.line: ...Grr...grrr... Aaarrrrgh! Grragh...

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Uncle! Hold on!

end.speaker: Renning
end.line: ...Unnnhh...

end.speaker: Reyson
end.line: ...It worked. He's sleeping peacefully. When he wakes, he should be his old self.

end.speaker: Elincia
end.line: Oh! Thank you, Reyson. Thank you!

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: So, how's Prince Reyson?

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: He's asleep with a big, contented smile on his face. He'll be fine.

end.speaker: Ranulf
end.line: I suppose we should give thanks to Goddess Ashera. Her power gave strength to Prince Reyson and saved Duke Renning's life.

end.speaker: Tibarn
end.line: It's hard to think of her as the bad guy after seeing a thing like that. Goddess Ashera, huh? I can't die until I see what she looks like.

narration: Ike and company manage to evade their persistent foes, finally arriving in Sienne, the capital of Begnion.

The Tower of Guidance. According to the Creed of the Goddess, which has been taught across the continent by Begnion, this is where the goddess Ashera will appear during times of great crisis to lead the people to safety. As even the smallest child in Begnion knows, the tower is sacred, and mere mortals may not enter.
With the world edging toward catastrophe, the tower glows like a pillar of pure light, as though to pierce through the very heavens.
